meanings.sent1: The priest gave a benedictory blessing to the newlyweds.
meanings.sent2: Her benedictory words brought comfort to those in need.
meanings.sent3: The cat's purring seemed almost benedictory, as if bringing good luck.
meanings.sent4: The sunrise painted the sky in a benedictory glow.
meanings.sent5: The gentle rain had a benedictory effect on the parched land.

meanings.sent1: We received a benedictory message from our friends on our anniversary.
meanings.sent2: His benedictory smile warmed everyone's hearts.
meanings.sent3: The benedictory card made her laugh with its funny message.
meanings.sent4: The flowers in full bloom were a benedictory sight in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's kind words had a benedictory impact on the students.

meanings.definition: Serving as a blessing or good omen
meanings.sent1: The rainbow after the storm felt benedictory to the travelers.
meanings.sent2: The old necklace was a benedictory heirloom passed down through generations.
meanings.sent3: Finding a four-leaf clover felt almost benedictory to the superstitious man.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected visit from a friend was a benedictory surprise.
meanings.sent5: The first snowfall of the season was a benedictory sign of good things to come.
